stimulusHtml: In a well-written essay, analyze how the symbolism of the character’s illness or mortality contributes to an interpretation of the work as a whole.

features.html:
Many works of literature feature a character who is sick or dying. That character’s illness or mortality can affect other characters and may serve as a symbol for a larger idea.

Either from your own reading or from the list to the left, choose a work of fiction in which a character is sick or dying. Then, in a well-written essay, analyze how the symbolism of the character’s illness or mortality contributes to an interpretation of the work as a whole. Do not merely summarize the plot.

In your response you should do the following:

  • Respond to the prompt with a thesis that presents an interpretation and may establish a line of reasoning.
  • Select and use evidence to develop and support your line of reasoning.
  • Explain the relationship between the evidence and your thesis.

 

  • All the Pretty Horses
  • As I Lay Dying
  • The Bell Jar
  • Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
  • Ceremony
  • The Color Purple
  • Dracula
  • Exit West
  • The Friend: A Novel
  • A Farewell to Arms
  • Great Expectations
  • Jane Eyre
  • The Joy Luck Club
  • King Lear
  • A Lesson Before Dying
  • Little Fires Everywhere
  • Little Women
  • Long Day’s Journey Into Night
  • Nervous Conditions
  • Never Let Me Go
  • Nineteen Eighty-Four
  • Oryx and Crake
  • Purple Hibiscus
  • Push
  • Rosencrantz and Guildenstern Are Dead
  • Saturday
  • Sense and Sensibility
  • Sing, Unburied, Sing
  • Station 11
  • The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
  • Sula
  • Swing Time
  • The Sympathizer
  • A Thousand Specific Suns
  • Their Eyes Were Watching God
  • To Kill a Mockingbird
  • Twain & Stanley Enter Paradise
  • When Breath Becomes Air
  • Wit
  • Wuthering Heights
